intro: Chylogala serrata, commonly known as the serrated chylogala, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely serrated leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Native to certain regions of Asia, it thrives in moist, temperate climates. The plant has a taproot system and is often found in woodland or shady areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study.
